section.title: SourceForge.net Software
section.para: CodeX is based on the open source platform SourceForge.net 2.0. For this reason, a large amount of the CodeX code is based on SourceForge source code. However, recent versions of SourceForge are no longer open source, so there is no new code coming from that project.

section.title: Based on Open Source software

listitem.para: Linux Distribution CodeX is supported on a very specific platform. For instance, CodeX 2.0 is supported on RedHat 7.2, whereas CodeX 2.2 is supported on RedHat Enterprise Server 3.0 (and maybe others)
Apache web server with additionnal modules: mod_php, mod_dav, and others.

para.emphasis: PHP, Python and Perl programming languages.

section.para: Note that CodeX 2.0 is built on top of Apache 1.3 and PHP3. CodeX 2.2 runs on Apache 2.0 and PHP4.

section.title: Database Structure
section.para: CodeX database contains over 180 tables. All project data (except file releases, mailing lists and project web site) is stored in the database. This includes documentation, artifact attachments, patches and code snippets.

Most tables correspond to a specific service. E.g. all tables with names starting with 'artifact_' are used by the tracker service. Note that 'bug_', 'support_' and most 'project_' tables deal with the three legacy trackers (bugs, support request and task manager).
Then, some tables are at site level: 'snippet_', 'stats_', 'trove_', etc.
And last, there are also a few important tables that are referenced in many others, e.g.:

listitem.para: groups contains project data (e.g. defined at creation time), and most notably defines the group_id, used almost everywhere!
user contains CodeX registered users data: user ID, name, login and encrypted password, status, etc.
